item.title: State of Python tooling
item.description: Recently I joined a team working mostly in Python. As usual, one of the first steps is getting development environment for the projects up and running. The first part was quick and easy: download a couple of config files & secrets, docker-compose up and we are up and running. Then came the hard part: getting local Python environment running for tests and code-completion. Preface I'm a big fan of direnv - having single .
